job_title: Nurse Manager in Pine Bluff, AR
pros: Hospital is the only medical center in a large referral area.  See's many patients with multiple problems. Offers all major surgical specialities except transplants. Very busy due to the type of patients in client area.  Managerial support is fairly good considering.
cons: Difficult city to live in, bad schools in city, average schools in suburbs.  Shopping is terrible. Restaurants are few.  Hospital is old with many new additions--spread out.  Has very difficult medical staff and two few specialists in key areas to spread the work around. Senior management seems to be top heavy, but they are supportive.  Good older population that supports the mission of the Medical Center.  Patient mix is getting worse with older, Medicaid and Medicare clients.  Many non-pay patients who are demanding.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Pine Bluff, AR
pros: We received over a $1.00 raise per hour;.  Short drive to work
cons:
We are nursing computers not patients,
Night shift on my unit has 2 RN's ` We do not have a 11pm -7am PCT unless we have more than 12 patients; We get a 3rd nurse if we have more than 15 patients.- all total care;  3pm-11pm  PCT's  charting baths, patient turns and hours rounds that are not performed; RN's complain and are accused of creating hostile work environment;  Management  response: They only have an 8 week education.  However; when State is expected we have plenty of staff.

Hate the 2 week track schedule for night shift - no time for family life.when 1st day off is sleeping  work M,T, F, S, S W, Th.

pros: Union Pay Scale. Doctors and Nurses that really care about Mental Health.  All the hours you want.  I was hired part time and routinely worked 12-16 hours overtime per week(meaning 52-56 hours).  20-40 per pay period was not unusual, especially around holidays. $2500 in two weeks for a Nursing Assistant!.  Pace is not realistic; but if you are in a bind and really need some cash, the work is available
cons: Politics.  Behavioral health is very "Provincial".  They treat you like personal property.  Working in another ward is treated badly. If you cover a shift in the Emergency Department, in addition to the Psych Ward; you can guarantee a 30 minute talk with a supervisor discouraging you from doing that again, and grilling you about your dedication to "The Unit" like it is some commando operation.  You also risk a UNION GRIEVANCE against you from a co-worker: stating that they should have been offered the shift based on seniority.  They will harass you. REVIEW EVERY PAYCHECK thoroughly! They are sloppy. You have 48 hours to file a revision form.(The claim is 3 days in the policy, but it never works becasue of the accountants "Discretion")   Make sure that all of your fees and Dues are being properly deducted: You can be terminated for 30 non-payment of dues, happens all the time; then you go back on a re-hire and a 90 day probation, again: making an entry-level pay that is 60% of normal pay. They will jerk you around and give your 1.5 (time-and-a-half) instead of double-time that you are entitled to for e.g. holiday weekend
